security_audit.summary: Pure prompt-based skill containing only markdown documentation, checklists, and code examples. No executable code, no network access, no filesystem access, no external commands. Contains no capabilities that could be exploited.

content.user_title: Review code for WCAG accessibility compliance
content.value_statement: Accessibility issues in code bases often go undetected until users report problems. This skill provides comprehensive checklists and patterns to identify and fix accessibility issues during code review, ensuring inclusive design from the start.
actual_capabilities: Review JSX for semantic HTML elements
Check form inputs for proper labeling
limitations: Cannot automatically run accessibility testing tools
Does not access external URLs or APIs
Limited to pattern recognition in code snippets

use_cases.title: Review React components
use_cases.description: Review React components for accessibility issues before merging pull requests.

use_cases.title: Manual testing guidance
use_cases.description: Get step-by-step guidance for manual accessibility testing of web applications.

use_cases.title: Documentation patterns
use_cases.description: Learn proper ARIA patterns and accessible component structures for documentation.

prompt_templates.title: Basic Component Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this React button component for accessibility issues. Check for keyboard navigation, screen reader support, and semantic HTML.

prompt_templates.title: Form Accessibility
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this form component for accessibility. Verify labels, error handling, and ARIA attributes are properly implemented.

prompt_templates.title: Modal Dialog Review
prompt_templates.prompt: Review this modal component. Check focus trapping, escape key handling, and screen reader announcements.

prompt_templates.title: Full Page Audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Perform a complete accessibility audit of this page. Check headings, links, images, forms, and interactive elements against WCAG guidelines.

output_examples.input: Review this React button for accessibility issues: <button onClick={handleClick}><TrashIcon /></button>
output: ⚠️ Missing accessible name - screen readers cannot announce this button's purpose
✅ Use aria-label='Delete item' to provide accessible name
✅ Consider aria-hidden='true' on TrashIcon to hide decorative icon
✅ Keyboard accessible - native button element supports Tab and Enter/Space

best_practices: Always use semantic HTML elements (button, a, input) instead of divs with event handlers
Provide visible focus indicators - never remove outline without replacement
Associate labels with form inputs using htmlFor/id or wrapping label patterns
anti_patterns: Using <div onClick> instead of <button> - breaks keyboard navigation
Removing outline: none without providing alternative focus indicator
Relying on color alone to convey information

faq.question: What WCAG level does this skill enforce?
faq.answer: The skill covers WCAG 2.1 Level AA requirements including contrast, keyboard access, and screen reader support.

faq.question: Does this skill integrate with automated testing tools?
faq.answer: The skill provides guidance for using axe-core and jest-axe but cannot run automated tests directly.

faq.question: Can this skill fix accessibility issues automatically?
faq.answer: No, the skill identifies issues and provides patterns for fixes but requires manual implementation.

faq.question: What data does this skill access?
faq.answer: This is a prompt-based skill with no code execution. It only processes text you provide during review.

faq.question: Does this skill work with frameworks other than React?
faq.answer: Yes. Core accessibility principles apply to all frameworks. The skill includes React-specific examples but concepts transfer to Vue, Angular, and vanilla HTML.

faq.question: How does this skill compare to browser extensions?
faq.answer: Browser extensions find violations in rendered pages. This skill catches issues during code review before deployment, enabling proactive fixes.
